title: MySQLDATE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLDATE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Extract the date part:
SELECT DATE("2017-06-15");

Definition and Usage
The DATE() function extracts the date part from a datetime 
expression.
Syntax
DATE(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required.  A valid date/datetime value. Returns NULL if expression is not a date or a datetime
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Extract the date part:
SELECT DATE("2017-06-15 09:34:21");

Example
Extract the date part (will return NULL):
SELECT DATE("The 
  date is 2017-06-15");

Example
Extract the date part:
SELECT DATE(OrderDate) FROM Orders;

★
+1

not a date or a datetime

From MySQL 4

Works in:

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLDATE()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLDATE()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLDATE()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
